item.title: Dicing [PI]
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I’m guessing just add it in the list that looks like this…I don’t use PI though.

[code] public int

saveDelay,
playerKilled,
pkPoints,
totalPlayerDamageDealt,
killedBy,
lastChatId = 1,
privateChat, 
friendSlot = 0,
dialogueId, 
randomCoffin, 
newLocation, 
specEffect, 
specBarId, 
    ...[/code]

item.title: Dicing [PI]

item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

You never declared the diceDelay variable in the Client class.

@devenb123 wrote:

hey im trying to add dicing and when adding this

if (itemId == 15098 && System.currentTimeMillis() - c.diceDelay >= 5000) { //Dice 100 c.startAnimation(11900); c.gfx0(2075); c.sendMessage("I have rolled a "+ Diceamount2 +" on the amount dice."); c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); } if (itemId == 15086 && System.currentTimeMillis() - c.diceDelay >= 5000) { //Dice 6 c.startAnimation(11900); c.gfx0(2075); c.sendMessage("I have rolled a "+ Diceamount1 +" on the amount die."); c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); } if (itemId == 15088 && System.currentTimeMillis() - c.diceDelay >= 5000) { //Dice blackjack c.startAnimation(11900); c.gfx0(2075); c.sendMessage("I have rolled a "+ DiceamountB +" on the amount die."); c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); } if (itemId == 15092 && System.currentTimeMillis() - c.diceDelay >= 5000) { //Dice 10 c.startAnimation(11900); c.gfx0(2075); c.sendMessage("I have rolled a "+ Diceamount3 +" on the amount die."); c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); }
